intro: Dolicholus angolensis, commonly known as the Angola milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy texture, and its flowers are typically yellow or orange with a distinctive corolla. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. Dolicholus angolensis is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
